title: Elephant sold to the tourism industry is reunited with its mother
text:

This is the heart-warming moment a young elephant was reunited with its mother at a sanctuary - and the pair hugged each other with their trunks in delight.
The young elephant named MeBai was only able to spend three and a half years with her mother before she was sold to the tourism industry in Thailand.
She was placed on a training programme and forced to entertain visitors to the country by being a main attraction in an animal riding service.
Their reunion concluded on a touching shot of the pair standing side by side and hugging each other with their trunks
But because she was too young, the elephant began losing weight and was unable to carry tourists, reported the Elephant Nature Park , the team behind her eventual rescue.
Removing her from her miserable situation, volunteers took the elephant to the sanctuary in Chiang Mai province and retired her from the trekking business.

According to the nature park, the young elephant was nervous when she first joined and unsure about the people at the sanctuary.
The young elephant named MeBai was only able to spend three and a half years with her mother before she was sold to the tourism industry in Thailand
However, she soon learnt that the sanctuary workers were not a threat to her and that they were not going to abuse her in anyway.
MeBai returned to enjoying a happy life but the story was to get even better for the elephant when her mother was tracked down at a neighbouring sanctuary.
Taking the decision to adopt the animal, the nature park were able to reunite the elephant named Mae Yui while her daughter.
Removing her from her miserable situation, volunteers took the elephant to the sanctuary in Chiang Mai province and retired her from the trekking business
Mae Yui was also retired from the trekking industry as a result of the move and the animals are now living together free and in the wild.
In the touching video, the elephants have an instant connection and stand next to each other while making a series of noises.
A woman providing a voice-over explains that the animals are communicating with each other through vibrations.
MeBai returned to enjoying a happy life but the story got even better for the elephant when her mother was tracked down at a neighbouring sanctuary
The lady goes on to say: 'This a beautiful moment, and this confirms to you that an elephant never forgets. Especially the love of the elephant.'
She later noted that it was a confusing time for the elephants as they were not sure whether they would be separated again - so they made the most of the moment they had together.
Their reunion concluded on a touching shot of the pair standing side by side and hugging each other with their trunks.
